thread.title: Northumberland's Matt Healy bags a Brit Award with band The 1975
thread.title_full: Northumberland's Matt Healy bags a Brit Award with band The 1975 | Tyne Tees - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Northumberland's Matt Healy bags a Brit Award with band The 1975

organizations.name: sunderland york north yorkshire newcastle county durham gateshead durham northumberland teesside tyne

text:
Northumberland-born Matt Healy has bagged a Brit Award, scooping 'Best British Group' with his band The 1975.
The 1974 win a Brit Award Credit: PA Frontman of the Indie-pop group urged musicians to use their "platform" during the band's victory speech.
"I just wanna say, at the moment, I think people in pop music and in the broader public consciousness are told to stay in your lane, stay in your lane when talking about social issues.
But if you have a platform don't do that, please don't do that."
– Matt Healy He added:
"We love you and we're very very honoured."
– Matt Healy The Manchester-formed band beat Radiohead, Bastille, Little Mix and Biffy Clyro to win their first Brit Award.
Last updated Wed 22 Feb 2017 Read more 3 updates Brit Awards: North East winners Sunderland York North Yorkshire Newcastle County Durham Gateshead Durham Northumberland Teesside Tyne and Wear Middlesbrough
